doc.previous: The written protohistory of Scotland began with the arrival of the Roman Empire in southern and central Great Britain when the Romans occupied what is now England and Wales administering it as a province called Britannia Roman invasions and occupations of southern Scotland were a series of brief interludes
doc.after: According to the Roman historian Tacitus the Caledonians turned to armed resistance on a large scale attacking Roman forts and skirmishing with their legions In a surprise night attack the Caledonians very nearly wiped out the whole 9th Legion until it was saved by Agricola s cavalry 44
